@graph.caption: Grape multigrain bread on a white cloth cut into slices

@graph.name: Grape Multigrain Sandwich Bread Loaf. Vegan - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: This vegan grape multigrain recipe is a tasty bread alternative, that is perfect for sandwiches. Homemade is always tastier than store bought!

itemListElement.name: Grape Multigrain Sandwich Bread Loaf. Vegan

@graph.name: Grape Multigrain Sandwich Bread Loaf. Vegan
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup millet or sorghum flour (I used millet)
2 Tablespoons raw sugar  (or equivalent sugar substitute)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the hot cereal in double the amount of water on low-medium heat, till the grains are soft(around 10 minutes). Let cool to a warm state. You can also add other cooked grains like Quinoa, barley, millet etc. Add a total 1 cup of cooked cereal.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the hot cereal in double the amount of water on low-medium heat, till the grains are soft(around 10 minutes). Let cool to a warm state. You can also add other cooked grains like Quinoa, barley, millet etc. Add a total 1 cup of cooked cereal.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the cereal, raw sugar and grapes into a puree and keep ready.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend the cereal, raw sugar and grapes into a puree and keep ready.

recipeInstructions.text: Warm 2 Tablespoons water and add 1 teaspoon raw sugar and yeast, mix and let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy. (If using stevia, dont add it to yeast mix. Add a teaspoon of flour instead of the sugar, mix and let it get frothy. Add stevia or natural sweetener to the grape mix.)
recipeInstructions.name: Warm 2 Tablespoons water and add 1 teaspoon raw sugar and yeast, mix and let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy. (If using stevia, dont add it to yeast mix. Add a teaspoon of flour instead of the sugar, mix and let it get frothy. Add stevia or natural sweetener to the grape mix.)

recipeInstructions.text: In the mixer bowl, add the flours(start with 1.5 cups bread flour), salt and whisk.
recipeInstructions.name: In the mixer bowl, add the flours(start with 1.5 cups bread flour), salt and whisk.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the oils, and yeast mixture and mix a bit.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the oils, and yeast mixture and mix a bit.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the warm grape puree and knead for 6-8 minutes, scraping the sides every 2-3 minutes into a not too sticky and soft dough. Add more bread flour or water if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the warm grape puree and knead for 6-8 minutes, scraping the sides every 2-3 minutes into a not too sticky and soft dough. Add more bread flour or water if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in well greased container. Spritz top with water, cover and let rise for 1.5 hours or until doubled( depends on ambient temperature)
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in well greased container. Spritz top with water, cover and let rise for 1.5 hours or until doubled( depends on ambient temperature)

recipeInstructions.text: Take dough out, knead it for a minute using a little more bread flour to reduce the stickyness(the fruit makes the dough stickier because of more moisture)
recipeInstructions.name: Take dough out, knead it for a minute using a little more bread flour to reduce the stickyness(the fruit makes the dough stickier because of more moisture)

recipeInstructions.text: Shape into a loaf by pulling on all sides, or by patting dough into a rectangle and rolling it like a jelly roll.
recipeInstructions.name: Shape into a loaf by pulling on all sides, or by patting dough into a rectangle and rolling it like a jelly roll.

recipeInstructions.text: Place in parchment lined regular bread loaf pan (with seam side down if jelly roll).
recipeInstructions.name: Place in parchment lined regular bread loaf pan (with seam side down if jelly roll).

recipeInstructions.text: Spritz top with water and then with oil and cover and let rise in a warm place,for 45 minutes or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Spritz top with water and then with oil and cover and let rise in a warm place,for 45 minutes or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 365 degrees F for 40-45 minutes, or until a tap on the top sounds hollow.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 365 degrees F for 40-45 minutes, or until a tap on the top sounds hollow.

recipeInstructions.text: Take bread out of the pan soon after removing from the oven.
recipeInstructions.name: Take bread out of the pan soon after removing from the oven.

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool for an hour before slicing. I usually refrigerate it another hour before slicing for less crumbly slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool for an hour before slicing. I usually refrigerate it another hour before slicing for less crumbly slices.
